website_summaries.verdict: With a sturdy frame and an adaptable design that grows with your baby, this rocker will last well beyond infancy.
pros: Durable construction adapts from an infant rocker to a toddler chair
Can be used as a stationary chair by lowering the kickstand
Features a removable toy bar with 2 colorful toys for stimulation
Calming automatic vibration is great for naps
cons: Toys are a bit large and can get in the way while rocking

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for baby
customer_reviews.text: It is not safe for my 8 month old Maybe this needs shoulder straps Baby is always hanging to the side or forward I think it needs more fabric to make it deeper
customer_reviews.author: VALERIA MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: Changing my review. It is cute and roomie for ...
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review. It is cute and roomie for a little one but if your child can sit up and move they will tip over. My 6 1/2 mo rocked forward onto his stomach and face. This is not safe
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My newborn sleeps all day on this! I love it
customer_reviews.author: vanessa rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: GET IT
customer_reviews.text: I like this better than my Mamaroo that I paid over $200 for. My 5 and 3 year olds love it too! I especially like that there is no hard plastic backing behind the cushion like there is in the Fisher Price Rock N' Play. This won't deform your baby's head. I was constantly stubbing my toes on my other bouncer, but I don't have that issue with this one. Perfect little rocker.
customer_reviews.author: elizma

customer_reviews.title: We love this chair
customer_reviews.text: We love this chair. Our four month old does too. He can sit up in it, lay down and play. It rocks and vibrates so that is a big plus. It is easy to set up, even though the instructions are kind of confusing. It is nice to have a product for children who are a bit bigger than usual. Our four month old is almost 19 lbs so having this chair with the weight limit is great. We’ve been looking at other products too, but are glad that we have bought this chair instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great chair that will last a while!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this chair! We got it because she was getting a little too big for her rock n play and the little bassinet I used to put her in when I'd shower. I take this chair into the bathroom now while I shower and she plays with the toys happily the whole time. Oftentimes she will also put herself to sleep, especially if I turn on the vibrations! It's a really cute little chair and she'll get a lot of use out of this. I like that it turns into a little rocking chair for when she's bigger.
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect seat for our fast-growing girl
customer_reviews.text: Our 6-month-old baby girl grew out of her swings and bouncers but she is still not able to seat without any support. This rocker is perfect because there is no bar by her feet that she will hit on as she grows and of course because it will last until she is a big girl.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: useful, practical
customer_reviews.text: Cute, useful, practical, inexpensive. All good things. I like the geometric pattern, it isn’t fussy or too bright, or cartoon-y like many baby items. It will grow with my child fine. I wish the toys were softer or at least a chew-able, more pliable material. They are hard and baby can’t pull them closer, but can bat at them. Removable toy bar is good. There are only 2 settings for the recline, but that’s fine. It’s inexpensive and doesn’t have a bunch of bells and whistles....to me it is blissfully simple and just what we need. The cover can be taken off easily to wash (see photo of pop-in plugs) Bonus points.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Concerning the clips won’t stay put
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat because it seems solid frame wise and the style of it but unfortunately the seat cushion won’t stay clipped in for nothing. Always pops out of place in the same two spots. My daughter is only 10 lbs so i can’t imagine this supporting her through the older years as it claims it’s safe to do when it can’t even stay clipped now.
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bouncer moves with baby!
customer_reviews.text: love this rocker! I just had my fourth and last baby 5 months ago so I consider myself to be “experienced” in the baby gear department ;) I love this rocker because as she moves, it moves! I love that it will grow with her too-I also feel like it’s very very stable which is important no matter how vigilant you are with an active toddler running around who also loves his baby sister a little too much
customer_reviews.author: Kevin&Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I can’t recommend this to another parent
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend this to another parent. I’m constantly having to snap the cushion back down. I got it because it’s suppose to grow with your child, but my 12lbs baby makes the cushion pop up... I can’t see us using it much longer. It’s very disappointing when you buy a product and can’t use it as it’s intended. We are past the point of returning it, so we store toys in it.
customer_reviews.author: ashley lee

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT: 8 month-old choked!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!! The seat cloth filling is accesible for the baby. Do not risk the life of your little angel with this unsafe product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ***NOT SAFE... CAN FLIP****
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old was able to flip the chair over and fell 3 feet from the kitchen table and landed upside down on the tile floor. While my back was turned for a minute going to fill his bottle. No visible injuries yet but definitely a scare. I won’t be able to sleep tonight so we will be going to the ER for reassurance. It might be okay if you use it on a floor - BUT NEVER, EVER use it on an elevated surface like a table.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 month old!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this chair! She is 3 months old and can't quite sit straight up right but has enough head control to not h a bobble had in this. This chair lets her sit up to play with out me having to hold her (she likes to be able to be independent). I especially live how it transitions into a toddler chair for when she older. Only thing I would change is to make the straps detachable so when she is toddler she can use it with out having to sit on the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 chairs to be able to set our 4 month old twins down, its great to have them upright and locked in their chairs vs constantly having to hold them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for babies
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old daughter has used this a few times now. I do not find this chair safe at all. The chair does not have shoulder straps. It only has the wait straps. When I stepped away for a few minutes, my daughter almost flip the chair over to one side by wiggling around. Luckily, I caught her in time. We all know babies don't like laying in 1 place for long periods. Now, I can't use the chair unless I am around her at all times. Not worth the purchase especially when you don't feel safe about the product. May better for toddlers but definitely not for babies.
customer_reviews.author: speedynick

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be much studied since they clearly label it toddler. My toddlers liked it for sure and both are well under the 40lbs weight limit and I thought they were going to bust it in half. Also not great for a baby who is 7 months and can clearly lean over the side and tip over. Maybe it’s good for brand new babies that can’t move. Not good for infant to toddler that’s for sure. Good luck if you do buy.
customer_reviews.author: Z Murray

customer_reviews.title: Toys are too big
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty awesome rocker. Its easy to rock and my daughter(2 months) loves the calming vibration. With that being said, the zebra/monkey on the toy bar are way too big and almost knock into her head if shes rocking! Usually we just have to keep it off which is sad because she loves staring at them.
customer_reviews.author: m.huynh.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby chair!
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! We have two of them. One here at Nana's and she has one at home. Easy to put together once you wrap your brain around it. The seat washed up nice before slipping it on to the frame. The best part is she can use it for a long time since it converts to a toddler rocker. This baby keeps growing longer and has outgrown another chair but has some good longevity in this one! That hanging monkey is pretty funny!
customer_reviews.author: Nlmcb

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my tall baby
customer_reviews.text: It fits an infant well from around 4/5 months up. My 7 month old was too tall and rough for her bouncer so I needed a more robust and longer frame. This fit perfectly. It is very stable with a wide base and rocks gently with baby's motion or your input. It also has a vibration switch. Highly recommended for a tall baby. Very comfortable. The only negatives: It came in it's manufacturer box with a shipping label stuck on, so not much shipping protection. And the instructions for assembly were very confusing. The diagrams were inaccurate. Luckily there isn't too many parts so you can figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Don’t rock with dangling toys attached. Otherwise we love this chair.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple instructions and easy to put together. The “upright” and “recline” are negligible—a lot like an airline seat. Biggest issue is the dangling toys. They are big and HEAVY and if you rock the baby (or he rocks himself) while the toy bar is up, they are big enough to swing and hit baby right in the face/head. Even when baby is in “recline” position. If your baby likes to sit up and lean forward you have to be very watchful... I think it’s designed not to easily tip forward but I think a particularly spirited child with enough velocity could easily rock it all the way forward.
customer_reviews.author: JE Hale

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with this the moment I assembled it. The vibration is strong which I love and It’s the feature I was mainly looking for in a bouncer!! The fact that it rocks is amazing, I don’t have to exhaust my leg and foot rocking a bouncer that isn’t meant to rock lol Also, the feature of reclining the seat to lie back or sit up is very useful! First time and my 2 month old daughter slept in it for 4 hrs. Couldn’t have chosen a better bouncer/rocker 👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: great chairb
customer_reviews.text: easy to put it together!, my baby love it! she had another one diferent and she barely like it. but in this one she spend more time and i put so extra tous on the thing!
customer_reviews.author: Rumi T

customer_reviews.title: Love , Love Love !
customer_reviews.text: Had this type of rocker with my daughter 7 years ago she sat in it till she was almost 5 years old ! I love the new design the thicker bottom . I've always been a fan of baby furniture that grows with the child . Love the new designs and the fact that these rockers don't break the bank !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the rock 'n play was recalled. This chair isn't that soothing or entertaining for an infant. I like that toddlers can use it too but it's pretty basic. It needs automatic rocking and it us basically like sitting your baby on the floor. It's too low to the ground which makes putting the baby in and out of it difficult. I also wish that you could detach the rattles from the arch so you could mix and match different things to hang.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Scary
customer_reviews.text: I did not feel like this item is safe. I returned it. Even following the weight guidelines and strapping my baby and it seemed like she could flip herself forward in this thing
customer_reviews.author: waxwingedmonkey

customer_reviews.title: One click this! DO IT!
customer_reviews.text: One click alert! DO IT! We had a standard wire frame bouncer for our son, but seen this in a store, and instantly found and ordered it here on Amazon! It fits a very tall infant, the vibrator is strong and it has a handy kickstand for sleeptime and newborns. Our son took all his naps in this seat until reaching 7 months old, and still falls asleep in it sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Off-grid momma

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that this rocker vibrates
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this rocker vibrates. It calms my baby very well bc of this. Only complaint, it doesn't provide much movement to rock it more, very minimal. Plus the vibrating only works 30% of the time maybe. You have to keep trying. Most of the time it doesn't engage and only wants to hun
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Stiner

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend..
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Wondering why I never tried his simple option before the expensive swings & all. The seat is so comfortable and the vibration is strong enough not to be annoying but does the soothing job well. The rocker is very lightweight that your LO could rock him/herself whilst batting at the toys yet sturdy enough that it doesn't tip them over. I still can't believe my son can nap on a no-arm place! Please mums with no help buy this for your own comfort and sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Haleemah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby with a big brother
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Easy to assemble and the fabric seat portion removes easily for washing. I keep this in the kitchen so my 4-month-old baby can be near me while I cook. She's still young enough to love the vibrating feature and this keeps her elevated enough to be able to look around at her surroundings. This chair does seem a wide for an infant, but I intentionally got something that her 3-year-old brother could also sit in, since he was inevitably going to try it out and I didn't want to worry about him breaking it! So far it's holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: hexappeal

customer_reviews.title: Not like the ones you bought a couple years ago
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th fisher price chair like this I have purchased. They used to have a metal frame. This is the first all Plastic one I have purchased and let me tell You it’s noticeable. I constantly think it’s about to fall apart. It’s not study and the toys are direct in the child face so you can barely see them and they can barely see you Disappointing. And tbh it’s really really ugly. I LOVED all my old ones I should of kept them
customer_reviews.author: Shacktus

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Chair for infants!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can move this all around the house and have my little one near me while I’m showering or cooking. However the rocking on this kinda sucks it’s very... what’s the word? Jagged? It just isn’t really a rocker and shouldn’t be advertised as one... I suppose if a toddler was using it and rocking themselves then yes it’s perfect. However I would buy this again. Wish it reclined all the way back that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: The Rivers

customer_reviews.title: A grow-with-me infant purchase (0-4 yrs)
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best infant purchase I’ve made. Bought this model sixteen years ago for my first child and fell in love with it, she was able to use it from infancy until she was five. I searched the web for its existence when I had my second child this past winter and found that Fisher Price improved it by replacing the metal parts with a smoothly rounded plastic. The price point has remained reasonable throughout the years. My new little one sleeps peacefully and plays comfortably in this thanks to the easy to use support bar on the base. The best part is that she’ll get to use throughout her toddler years as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Shorter-Schrade

customer_reviews.title: $25 well spent
customer_reviews.text: My 2 month old has every gadet you can think of. But will only sit in them for 10 to 15 minutes before getting bored. Her expensive swing and other gadets were a complete waste. I can put her down in this and for some reason she loves sitting in it. She will even fall alseep in it. The vibrating weirded her out at first because she had never experienced anything like it, but I think she finds in comforting now. My husband assembled this while I was in the other room. I think he used a drill but I'm sure you could just use a screw driver.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Welch

customer_reviews.title: Grows with baby
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it grows with my child through all stages up to toddler! But warning if your baby is just learning to sit up and rock pull out the bar that is under the chair it will stop the chair from rolling over on top of the baby!!! PLEASE REMEBER THE BAR UNDER THE CHAIR! A lot of moms are saying this is unsafe that the chair flips on the baby but if you pull the bar out it wont rock any more forces kids to recline back. This chair is safe and it works amazingly
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy & great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have had this for my first child as it grows with them instead of being another baby item that has only a few months worth of use. My baby grew out of the reclining position very quickly but loves this one still because the back adjusts to sit more upright. My older child weighs a little over 40 pounds and I found her rocking in it with no adverse effects to the seat. Very sturdy & great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee

customer_reviews.title: Good chair but it doesn’t rock well
customer_reviews.text: My 18 lb baby fits in this chair very well. I would recommend it as a vibrating chair for a growing baby. I however bough this one because they say it will rock... Only thing it doesn’t really live up to That. It has a hard time rocking at all and it’s pretty much a joke. Especially if you have slick flooring like wood which i have. If i put it on a rug it does kind of rock just not well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby chair
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this chair/rocker when my kids were babies/toddlers. I have now purchase this chair twice for different grand babies. My daughters love that they can flip the arm down and stop it from rocking, the back has a couple different adjustment heights, allowing for sitting up or reclining. With the back down and the chair in non-rocking position it is like a baby recliner and is great when baby is sick with a stuffy nose and can't sleep. My older grand kids call it their beach chair and sit in it to read or watch tv.
customer_reviews.author: Lanorah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Live and learn
customer_reviews.text: This product is as advertised but I am slightly disappointed only in that my granddaughter does not care to be in it. It could be that she is just a baby who prefers to sit up more, but at 4 months old I thought this would be an appropriate seat for her. I was hoping that there was a way to let her sit in a more upright position since it says it is for infants to toddler, but that is not possible. Also, she can bat at the toys but cannot actually grab the toys that hang on the chair. I have a grandson due soon so perhaps he will get more use from this seat.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Ok chair instructions suck. Make sure you get size C batteries before it arrives
customer_reviews.text: Got this today and put it together. Seems to be alright. The instructions are some what hard to understand step three was irritating bc it says “fit cross brace between the side rails” and has a crappy picture and doesn’t tell you where it goes. This product was very annoying to put together with a baby crying at you. It could be so much more simple if the instructions were a little bit more clear. Also when you rock it the toys swing so easy they almost hit baby in the face and he flinches every time they swing at him.
customer_reviews.author: MLE

customer_reviews.title: My baby is a giant one like born 9lb
customer_reviews.text: My baby is a giant one like born 9lb, look like 2 years old toddler when he's one year old. He needed a chair where he can climb up into and get out by himself. This is perfect for him. He use it when he take his own bottle. It's curving like I used to hold him to feed a bottle. I guess that's why he like that chair. Quality wise it's very sturdy with rubber foot things at the bottom. It's functional, safe, and with good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Su Y. Ni

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT. Like really screw the normal bouncers. This rocker is great. I purchased because my other bouncer broke. And it turns into a toddler chair! Yes! I love that I have wood floors and you can easily scoot it with your hands or feet to move it. Most bouncers have rubber feet so I have to pick It up. There is one issue and that is the toys. They are hard and since it rocks it swings hard toys at them. I don’t use it with them and I may cut them off and replace with something else. Vibration could be stronger but not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed. I ordered this seat back in july and within 2 weeks stopped vibrating. So I contacted Amazon and had a new one sent, and again within 2 weeks the seat stopped vibrating. A good friend of mine also had this seat and she had the exact same problem. I am being refunded though, so at least there's that. Spend a little more and get a better seat!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I have twins. They are 6 months & had grown out of a different rocker we had for them. I love this chair. The weight limit is 40lbs which allows the twins to grow with it. They are 16lbs & 20lbs now so they have a bunch of time to grow with this product. I put it together myself while my boyfriend was at work. It took me less than 30 minutes. The directions were fairly easy. I would recommend this product to anyone. It's great for the twins to sit in while I'm doing dishes or vacuuming. I like that the activity bar is removable.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, a pain putting together...
customer_reviews.text: I really do love this device for my child (and she loves it too). I was looking for something that I could put her in when I’m needing my hands but would also keep her entertained. This is an excellent option. I took one star off because putting it together took much longer than necessary due to the back bar. The description in the manual of how to put it together is awful and I had to step away and go back to it to figure it out. I have no problem putting things together usually so for something like this it shouldn’t be an issue but slightly was. Regardless my daughter and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy out of all the useless baby stuff we’ve bought
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s got a cute pattern and it matches our space saving fisher price high chair. It was easy to put together; maybe 10 minutes at most. Our baby loves this rocker. He’s started holding his head more and I think he prefers this over his bassinet, swing, and boppy lounger. It takes C batteries and cannot be plugged in. I’d prefer to plug it in but it’s whatever. Battery lasts a long time. I don’t know if it has an auto shut off feature but I keep forgetting to shut it off and it’s still going. The vibration is surprisingly strong; no complaints. It’s pretty compact. Easy to move all around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Best baby gear purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great for little ones. We have one at every house the baby goes to. Helped get baby to sleep when tiny infant, the vibration is great for the price. Now we lock it so we use for feeding baby food at 6 months. And it will last even longer when she can use as a sitting chair her size. One of the best investments.
customer_reviews.author: Pams Purchases

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable rocker for baby
customer_reviews.text: After multiple children our old bouncy chair was reaching the end of its days. With a large dog and a toddler, we decided we wanted something a little more sturdy for a replacement. Went with this rocker and we do not have a single regret! My baby loves it and it keeps her more stable when a sibling wants to give her a hug. She can also rock herself now when she waves her arm. And if my toddler climbs into it when the baby isn’t in it, it’s fine because the chair can take up to 40 lbs of weight. It’s been a win purchase for our situation!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: My Angel's chair...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my grandson after I had purchased a previous one, which I had to return. This rocker chair is great for the baby, he loves it. He falls asleep 😴 with the vibration and he is in the right position. It has a bar underneath that you can pull out and the baby is in a level sleep position. The good thing is he could keep using it as a toddler chair when he sits on his own. We are very satisfied with this rocker, finally they thought of the baby and not just the product.😍
customer_reviews.author: Zena

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bouncy seat that grows with child
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute seat. I wanted one that would be versatile and adjust as they grow so I get longer use than a regular infant bouncy seat. So far, the baby is almost 4 months and it’s been great. She’s too little to do much with the toys or anything, but I like it. It’s lightweight and easy to carry around and I like that the toy bar comes off easily. I look forward to using it as she grows as the seat back reclines and can sit up more like a little chair. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiona Kimble

customer_reviews.title: My daughter love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a single mom of a two month old. She doesn’t like to be put down for long so as you can probably imagine taking a shower, cooking, cleaning, etc is rather difficult! But this little rocker is a game changer. She’ll sit in it without the vibration on for a good 15 minutes and with it on 30 minutes. She always gets a big smile when she sees the lion toy. And for me, I LOVE the pattern and color scheme. It’s nit bright and ostentatious like so many baby products. I think it’s safe to say that we both really like this rocker!
customer_reviews.author: hello.jazzi

customer_reviews.title: Very useful infant rocker
customer_reviews.text: A very nice, easily portable, inexpensive infant rocker. We would not suggest this for a toddler who could roll out of it. Especially useful in situations when you want to keep infant in sight but have things to do (meal prep, home office, etc.). I had some minor difficulty putting this item together but the picture on the box cleared up ambiguous instructions. Note: Infant's mother prefers Geo Triangles colors over Geo Diamonds. Infant doesn't seem to care.
customer_reviews.author: ACAR

customer_reviews.title: Good rocker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, safe for baby, rattle is in the right spot for the baby to reach. When baby kicks it rocks and rattle makes noises. Let me see how long it last. Overall good rocker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon prime member

customer_reviews.title: Cute little chair
customer_reviews.text: Cute chair! I used it without toy bar- my little guy loves me rocking him and the toys swing back and forth too much! Overall good value for the money as we use it a lot! Also vibration is a good feature!
customer_reviews.author: Alina B-C

customer_reviews.title: Hope you don't like to have the vibrate on
customer_reviews.text: Loved this chair until the vibrator started acting up. I own three, all three are messed up. We now have to physically turn the chair on its side to get it to engage. Kind of expensive to stop working properly 2 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together and I love the quality of the product, it's very sturdy. The seat has enough padding so it's comfortable. I had one issue during assembly and that was where one of the screws was supposed to go the hole was covered by a thin sheet of hard plastic so I couldn't get the screw through I had to take the screwdriver jam it through to open it up first but it wasn't that big of a deal. So far I love this and I bought it for my one year old who isn't super impressed yet but my four year old thinks it's the bee's knees.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea H.

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, gender neutral, lightweight rocker
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. The colors were adorable, gender neutral, and the rocker was more modern looking than most on the market. The fabric is pretty plush compared to other products we tried. It rocked smoothly on carpet and hardwood floor. It was light and easy to move from room to room. It's a good price. Best of all, it was easy to rock with my foot, I could easily rock this gently while cooking dinner or sitting down. That said, my two month old absolutely would not stand it. He doesn't like swings and unfortunately I think this motion is just too similar that. He did seem to be engaged by the toys though.
customer_reviews.author: C & T Blachford

customer_reviews.title: My baby has sat in this chair a little bit ...
customer_reviews.text: My baby has sat in this chair a little bit every day since she was about one month old. We hung an extra toy on it, her froggy, and she loves it! Froggy was the first toy that she grabbed and put in her mouth. You get about 20 minutes to take a shower (just bring it in the bathroom with you), clean the kitchen, or eat dinner without any fussing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rocking chair.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second rocker for downstairs since the mamaroo is too heavy to carry. This is excellent, super light and my 10wk old preferred this over the other. Very trendy gender neutral relaxing colors, easy to clean fabric. Sturdy enough that my almost 4y old watched a movie and took a nap there. Love it and would recomend to everyone
customer_reviews.author: tabbanah

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Even though my son is six(he's a premie so still on the small side) he still rocks in this. We had an older one that broke, he needs his rocking chair like some kids need their blanket or toy. It's very easy to assemble or take apart to wash(which we have to do often since white gets so dirty from him putting his feet under his butt) I only gave four stars since when put together using a screwdriver by hand, the screws holding the back bar to the sides come out. Even tightened as tight as I can, the screw still came out. I had to use a drill. Great little chair for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: I received the chair and put it together with not much struggle. My daughter loves it and is happy when placed in it. She loves kicking the little toys with her feet. The reason I give it only 3 stars is I'm very concerned about the safety of this chair. I would never leave my daughter unattended even for a few minutes to run to another room. The snaps that are supposed to hold the chair in constantly come out. I feel like I'm pushing them back in at least 5 times a day. An seems how the seat solely relies on the snaps to hold it in place it is a bit concerning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Baby Loves!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this rocker. We have used beginning at 3 months... she is now 6.5 months. She likes it because she can sit up and loves playing with hanging toys. It perfect to keep in the kitchen to keep her entertained while I'm cooking, doing dishing or eating. The reason I gave 4 stars instead off 5 is because the toys are very hard and the green triangle has square corners. My little one hits the toys and they fly back toward her face... YIKES! You can add or change the toys. But, she truly loves it and it keeps her occupied!
customer_reviews.author: Rsciory

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we bought for our child and ourselves
customer_reviews.text: After trying many things for our little guy this chair was the winner. He was able to be in it firm a young age since it has a “kick stand” if you will, that steadily holding it in a laid back position. When the “kick stand” is released he used it like an adult would use a lazy boy chair. The vibrating option saved us many times during screaming fits and we did not have to replace the batteries often. Since the maximum weight is high our smaller 5 year old loved to sit in it and use it as a rocking chair. It is very durable and lightweight and worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: amcayanan

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is confusing but end product well worth it
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are awful, no much needed close up illustrations, just small diagrams. I ended up online and found an amateur how to video that was so much better then struggling (I’ve assembled countless things, so I’m telling you for sure the illustrations are terrible. Once I got it together it’s sturdy! A hefty 5 month old is in it with ample room and yet somehow it’s still not bulky. He loves the toy bar too. Looking forward to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Judith L Murello

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy. It's been 7 years since I last had a baby and it's much sturdier than those older chairs that were more springy than a rocking chair. Easy to assemble. I dont have batteries on hand so I don't know how well it vibrates but I'm sure it'll be fine. I did not have a crooked seat either like some reviewers. The kick stand is also nice and handy and it's larger than expected which is a plus for toddler aged children to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect chair for my 4 month old and I love that it reclines all the way back if they fall asleep! A must have.
customer_reviews.author: Hossai

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal, has great longevity potential, looks very stylish!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. It took about 10 minutes to assemble (with a toddler and month old). Once assembled, it doesn't take up *too* much room and it's lightweight without feeling flimsy. My infant fits nicely in it and since it doesn't have a hard plastic seat, it's comfortable. My toddler also tested the seat attribute and he loves it. If I had known about these with my first, I would have repurchased another one for my second. I love products that have more than one use especially since babies grow up so fast. It's also at an excellent price point and it looks very modern and cute!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We love it! It was easy to assemble and also easy to move around as needed. Even my 3y old toddler likes to sit and watch TV on it. I can see some having the concern about the snaps being weak but they have hold great with both kids ( baby almost 3 months now weights 9 and toddler around 33) and still looks/feels as sturdy as day one. I think once baby is able to sit up, I’ll probably use it more with the stabilizer at the bottom, instead of the rocking. I do recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchie

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby and toddler (less than 40 lbs)!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my baby when he was a few months old. The back of the chair can be more upright or reclined. It is easy to assemble, the seat cover is easy to take off to wash in case of peep (pee + poop). My baby sits forward and the chair has little legs that stop it from toppling forward. Luckily the seat cover is washable because every time baby poops while sitting in the chair, poop leaks up his back or down a leg. My 3 year old who is not yet 40 lbs also likes to rock in it when baby is not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T

customer_reviews.title: Decent. Plastic alone not so sturdy & not collapsible.
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors & design. Was a bit difficult for myself to put together at first but I was also rushing it since I was excited for it to be set up for my daughter. It’s not as sturdy as I expected when it comes to the two main pieces which are made out of plastic but once put together it seems okay. I wish it had a collapsable option to move around or travel with like others do since this one graduates to her toddler years also but it does not.. will update my review if something changes but for now I like it (:
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Safe & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this for use in my in-home daycare so it gets above average use on a daily basis. We love the fact that both infants and toddlers fit in this nicely. Unlike other rockers this one will not tip. I also like the fact that It has rubber feet and will not scratch my floors. The liner is easy to remove and launder. This is hands-down the best and safest seat we have ever used. We liked it so much we bought another one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, works for my 25-day-old
customer_reviews.text: It took me some time to assemble the rocker..with my own tools.... But it works on my little fussy 25 days old baby. We didn't plan on using it for whole day, but we are sure will use it more in the next few months. It's solid and looks nice, I like the size as well, not too big/heavy. Will recommend it to my friends-- if the baby would like to stay inside, I' ve heard some babies do not like to be put in the rocker.
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: Durable from infant to Toddler
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and durable. If you have a toddler and a baby on the way get several of these!!! You can’t beat the price for a chair that holds your toddler and tilted back adjustable seat for your infant!!! It works with a growing baby!! Highly recommend. Yes it needs assembled but don’t let that stop you. Take time to do it even if that means missing a nap because it’s worth it. I put it together at 9 months pregnant and now both my toddler and baby are enjoying it and you can’t beat this price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nevaeh

customer_reviews.title: Very Cute
customer_reviews.text: I like this chair. My little is only 3 months and I got it because it said it would follow her into toddler hood. It does not come with batteries and we have not yet found some that is compatible with the chair. So I can not rate the vibration. The batteries it reacquires are not the type that one would typically have in the home. It's really cute. The straps are great. The animal toys on the bar do not come off. I wish that they did as sometimes they look like they are about to hit my little in the face when gently rocking.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Product is exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The chair design is pretty and exactly like the picture but it is so annoyingly complicated to put the stabilizing pedal on. The instructions on that part were vague and literally says "if it doesn't fit one way try the other way". I was starting to think I got a faulty chair until I went on YouTube and found a video assembling the chair and was made to understand that the clips are upside down on opposite sides (odd). My chair also seems slightly lopsided as I read on another review after I'd ordered. But I bought it to rest my newborn so she's not in her crib all day. I trust it will be sufficient for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeitha S.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but assembly isn't clear
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, especially since once it's too big for infants it can transition to a rocker seat for toddler. You get longevity out of it, it's easy to move around the house room by room or pack up to take with you somewhere, and easy to clean. Worth the price tag. The reason I gave it four stars is because the instructions for assembly are a bit confusing for such a simple seat. It also was missing a screw, so I've got to find one that will work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a newborn
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is only 2 weeks old so haven’t had much time with chair. I bought it cause I liked how it would grow with her. It is another “safe” place to put her when I need to do something but that’s about it for now. It doesn’t vibrate or rock on its own. Wish I bought a bouncer seat that vibrates because I am a single mom on a budget and would be using that now but I do already have this for when she gets older. All and all happy with product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to meager described features.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions didn't give us enough information. The cross bar slides into a cutout but be might never have known that if not for a private party assembly video. As a chair it seems reasonably useful and as a place to nap as well. It takes two C batteries to provide a calming vibration but ours will only do this vibrating if you hold it down continuously and even then I think it's actually just making a low humming sound. I assume this means it's defective but it took over a month to deliver so...I guess we keep it for what it is though it is not quite as it was promised.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago71

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Edited: after misplacing the toy bar, I called fisher price as directed (I asked the question on amazon if I could purchase the toy bar separately). They didn’t even question me and they didn’t have the toy bar that came with the chair, but had a compatible one and just shipped it to me for free. It was awesome! Great customer service. My baby boy loves this chair. He is in it a lot. My older boys (3 and 5) also try to play in it and it’s held up really well. My only complaint would be that the white part has gotten dirty really fast, but it’s totally worth it and still getting 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: It is super cute and came really early in the mail. Babies will either love or hate a product, it’s generally the preference of the baby. Some babies just like rockers and some don’t. So whether mine likes it or not I won’t complain about that lol. I’m sure he will love it, I put him in it for a minute but had to feed him. He fit really well and it’s a very sturdy rocker. The manual was not the most descriptive in directions, I had to really eyeball the product and imagine how it should fit to figure it out. Luckily not too many pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, sturdy, soft
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble and is super cute. One thing that I love about it is that it matches the bassinet and a high chair that I have too. I haven’t had to clean it yet so I can’t say much about that but I’ll update when I do. Overall it’s sturdy and a really cute vibrating chair. I wouldn’t call this a bouncer though. I also really love the fact that it turns into a rocker when baby gets toddler age.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kuykendall

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Baby Rocker
customer_reviews.text: Received it and finished assembling it. I love this rocker, it is sturdy, and i like that it reclines and has a protective bar to keep rocker from rocking so baby wont fall out. Its beautiful and it is for my first grand daughter baby due in March 2021. This will be a Christmas Gift, it will make it easy for my daughter in law to carry the baby around the house. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Gooseylloosey

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair!!!
customer_reviews.text: As an infant lays in the chair the toys are not too close to their head as others complain about. They are supposed to be within reach and sight. Yes, they will have to come off later, but by then she will have toys in her hand to play with and have no need for the arch over her. The chair was easy to put together, sturdy, and I don’t see the snaps coming apart anywhere in the future.
customer_reviews.author: alittlesangels

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy i use it for my one month old the sitting position isn't too great for her. But it has a feature that you pull out a level at the bottom and it lays the chair. My baby loves it she stays calm in there falls asleep on her own. My 3 year old has sat on it while on the chair position and it holds her very sturdy no concerns at all. The colors are great they are vibrant ! So far no CONS
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I like the neutral colors and the sturdy look of it. I assembled it fairly easily on my own in a half hour or so. Looking forward to using it when my baby comes in a few months :) After a few weeks of use: my newborn rests comfortably in this and takes mosts of his naps in it. It's nice to have him propped up after a feeding and he usually relaxes and goes off to sleep. It's light enough to move from room to room and allows me to put baby down close by wherever I am.
customer_reviews.author: Tanisha

customer_reviews.title: Great rocker!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this chair. He's 6 months old and is getting bored of laying back in his Graco Duet swing/rocker. He wants to sit up! This rocker saves the day! It keeps him up, safe and secured. The toy bar is great to practice reaching and hand/eye coordination. We also use it to feed him baby food since we're tight on space and haven't gotten a high chair yet. We prop it up against the sofa so it doesn't rock and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Warffle

customer_reviews.title: Best seat for Infants/Twins!
customer_reviews.text: The price of the product is outstanding compared to the quality. We got the pink one and the diamond one for our twins. One was a gift, and then after a month we decided to go ahead and buy another. They are easy to put together and easy to move around. The angles that they lay in are perfect and my twins love these chairs. It will also convert as they get older to sit up and be an actual toddler chair. I totally recommend this for all the babies!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Bruns

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Safe
customer_reviews.text: I struggled trying to find the right seater for my 3 months old baby. They all come either too flat or too tight or just not safe at all. This model reminded me of the basic rockers we had when we were children, wide enough, sides are high to protect the baby from falling off, deep enough to last longer for a bigger baby and the base has the perfect stability, though its plastic, but i see it safer than the thin legs. I love this and I can see me using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rawan Darweesh

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: I really love this seat and so does baby. It’s really nice that you can position the chair in a up, rocking position or lean it back for sleeping. One of the reasons we chose this chair was because it can be used as a toddler chair too. Makes it worth the price since they can use it for a long time. My toddler has tested it too, loves rocking and sitting in it. Update- we’ve had it for two years and it’s held up so well/ still being used. We’re buying a second one for another baby so the toddlers can still use the first one, it’s there go to spot to sit and read books.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my infant grandchild. She seems to enjoy sitting in it. I figured it would grow with her to become her seat as a toddler. My oldest grand child wouldn't sit in it at first because he said it was for his sister. Now when I pull it out for her, he wants to sit in it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Deb N.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rocker!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than the other vibrating chairs that bounce. I love that I can get a little work done and rock the 2 month old with my foot. He really likes looking at the 2 attached toys and it’s easy to take off she you want to rock them while sleeping. I HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Honestly I would return if I wasn't so lazy
customer_reviews.text: 1. the diagram for installing is terrible 2. it slides around too much when you rock 3. baby can fall off in the forward direction even with the belt honestly it's pretty badly designed, it's a potential baby killer
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to replace our bouncer and decided to buy this. My daughter absolutely loves it and I love that it transitions to a toddler seat. The vibrations are nice and it goes off automatically so you don’t waste battery which is a huge plus. The only downside is it’s a bit bigger than the average vibrating chair so you need to have the right space for it. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Giant babies need this
customer_reviews.text: Omg I dont know how I lived without this. I got rid of all the other bouncer, swings, rockers, etc. I have large babies (20lb 3month old, 30lb 2 year old) and they max out all other seats long before they are developmentally able to sit unassisted. This works amazingly. It's light and portable. It took all of 10 minutes to screw together. Super sturdy. Both babies love it
customer_reviews.author: tinychef

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase since bringing baby home
customer_reviews.text: We were greatly under prepared for our newborn. We didn’t have toys, a swing or lounger so we had to go through a lot of trial and error. For the price this is hands down one of our favorite purchases! Our baby loves her seat. We eat dinner with her in it, take it outside when we do yard work, while I shower she sits in this... and it’s easy on the eyes. It’s very cute and isn’t something I mind leaving out in our house (I know that’s very low on most people’s lists of concerns but I’m a neat freak). I’ve recommended others but this already, it’s a wonderful item.
customer_reviews.author: MBetz

customer_reviews.title: Babies like it
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the things we bought for our new born I think this is the only one she liked. She sits comfortably in it, sleeps in it. Rocking is good on hard floor. Only reason I gave it 4 star is assembly time and also the fact that the battreies type is totally different from other devices. I already had 4 type of battries at home and this requires a 5th type.
customer_reviews.author: iqra arshad

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: You have to assemble this, but it doesn't take too long. As others have mentioned, it will tip forward over. Using the kickstand avoids that danger. All things considered, it's cute, and the price point is affordable. Pros Arrived on time Cute Affordable Cons: Shipped in the box the chair is in. Not a retainer box. Glad it wasn't a gift. Will tip - Use kickstand!
customer_reviews.author: TruRevu

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought it for my 3m old because he can't sit up yet but doesn't like laying flat all the time anymore. Now he can comfortably watch us do things around the house and it makes him happy. He gets his little feet kicking and the toys swing and rattle. It's so light so it's easy to bring from room to room. I also really enjoy the kick stand feature so when he's sleeping, he doesn't get rocked. Well worth the investment and would make a great baby shower gift!
customer_reviews.author: Meroladm

customer_reviews.title: Very light abd sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is very light to carry around the house and sturdy too. I have a 26 lbs baby and she had a habit of taking naps in the mamaroo, since she reached its weight limit , the mamaroo started making weird crackling sounds and making crazy movements I was looking for one with higher weight limits and this is what I found. My baby loved it as soon as I started to rock her. It's way cheaper than the mamaroo , lighter and easy to move around the house. I love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Tshering Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great chair! First
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! First, I love that both my newborn and my toddler can use this chair. With a new baby in the house, I was constantly telling my jealous toddler to leave the baby gear alone and finally this was something that she could use too. Also, I have a very large growing boy, wearing 9 month clothes at only 3 months. While my son is quickly outgrowing his bouncers and swing, this chair provides a little more room and he fits in it much better. My only complaint is that one of the tabs that attaches the material to the frame is constantly popping out, but I would still definitely recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Infant-to-Toddler Rocker - Floral Confetti
product_meta.description:
Style:Floral ConfettiThe Fisher Price Infant to Toddler Rocker starts out as a stationary infant seat or rocker with bat at toys overhead for play time. Then, as your baby grows, you can easily remove the toy bar and convert it to a toddler chair for children up to 40 lb (18 kg). It's the perfect spot for your baby to relax, play, or have a snack!

BRAND STORY
By Fisher Price
feature_bullets: Stationary baby seat and rocker for use from infant to toddler (up to 40 pounds/18 kilograms)
Adjustable seat recline and removable toy bar with 2 bat at toys
Calming vibrations help soothe and comfort your baby

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,376 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
